title: attempting to reconenct every 2 minute
body:

replies.body:
For those of you reporting issues from Canada, we have seen consistent reports of certain ISP's providing poor network path's to our servers, causing issues with instability.  The best way to confirm this is to [submit a ticket](https://support.leagueoflegends.com/anonymous_requests/new) to our Tech Team and provide attached [tracerts](https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2).  Our specialists can take a in-depth look into your issue and determine where the root cause is.

If you are not living in Canada, then it is a lot harder to determine the root cause of the issue.  First, I want to rule out any possible issues with your local network.   To do this, make sure to complete all of the steps in the following guide:

https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/26932010-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues

If you are still experiencing issues, it's possible that the root cause is somewhere else.  The best way for us to find it is to have you [submit a ticket](https://support.leagueoflegends.com/anonymous_requests/new) and provide the following Network Logs:

1) Network Analysis: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1

2) NetworkInfo Log: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4

3) Process List: https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/27495980-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3

I did this and currently have a ticket open and am "talking" to someone (although Ms. Noodle has yet to respond since 5 am). how will sending u this information fix anything? 

also, is it the same problem that your company posted about 26 days ago in the "Regarding Recent Instability on North America" post?

The logs that I mentioned in my first post do not actually "fix" anything as they are not intended to by a type of troubleshooting step. It gives us an in-depth look into the health of your local network (or network path) and will let us know what troubleshooting steps you should take in hopes of resolving the issue.  

And to answer your second question, this problem does not seem to be at all related to the "Regarding Recent Instability on North America" post.  That is why completing all of the steps in the Knowledge Base Article are incredibly important!
Well i submitted my ticket with the link and attachment. None of the self done diagnostics worked.

But I'm having a similar problem where I disconnect during champ select around 3-6 times and when I get into game I attempt to reconnect every minute or so. My friends and I have had the same problem and we are from Kentucky? Its also sad that I can play league like that and lag but then immediately go play a game or 2 of SMITE and not lag a single time.... Completely uncalled for in my opinion....
I've had this problem for a few weeks now.

For everyone that started disconnecting a few days after Patch 4.16. Did it start happening only shortly after the patch? Does it work completely normal for a minute or two then start "attempting to reconnect" even when it says your ping and fps are fine? Sliding across the screen and then at 500 ping and disconnect? Does it work completely normal everywhere else on the game and only sometimes mess up during load screen then disconnect once in game?

So if your internet is fine and everything else is normal. Then here is your solution. Go and delete the lol_launcher folder. C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects Should be 6 folders in there. Delete only the "lol_launcher" folder. Have the game client closed before. Then reopen the game and it should repatch with a brand new folder in like 2-5 seconds. I went in a custom after doing that and no more retarded sliding across the map and attempting to reconnect or disconnect. Finally freaking fixed. If the solution happens to not work for you, then I'm guessing your problem might be a bit different than mine.

are you sure?  Because the bigger problem for me is that it doesn't happen every game. Sometimes I can have 4-5 clean games with no lag or DC, then when I decide the problem has stopped and play a ranked game or two, it starts doing this all over again.

Yeah, it also did that to me a couple times yesterday before I decided to delete that folder. It was working fine one day, then started messing up all night. Then it coincidentally acted fine during my Co-Op for my win of the day after I woke up. Then later when I went in a regular match, the problem returned. So then I closed all applications, made sure everything was up to date, restarted my computer, then deleted that folder and open the client. Repatched folder as brand new and problem was gone. If you do this solution and it doesn't fix it for you, then yours might be something different than mine.

Although I will point out on thing I noticed before fixing it. PBE server works perfectly. Great ping and fps, so why do I DC only on the live server? So I thought it might be a corrupted file for the live game. I came across that deleting that folder might help and it worked for me. So I thought I'd see if it would help anyone else having a similar problem.
